intro: Pentopetia androsaemifolia subsp. ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf pentopetia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide range of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
